Abstract: The field of Aerospace Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) has undergone significant evolution, becoming an indispensable tool in the design and analysis of aerospace systems. This paper provides a comprehensive perspective on the current state of aerospace CFD technology, highlighting its pivotal role in addressing complex fluid dynamics challenges. We explore the integration of advanced computational methods and high-performance computing resources that have propelled the accuracy and efficiency of simulations. Furthermore, the discussion extends to the industrial challenges faced in applying CFD, including the need for improved turbulence models and the management of computational costs. Looking ahead, we anticipate the future trajectory of aerospace CFD, emphasizing the potential for machine learning and AI to revolutionize predictive capabilities and design optimization in aerospace engineering.
